meanings.sent1: That wacko always wears mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: The town thought he was a wacko because he talked to invisible friends.
meanings.sent3: The wacko decided to wear a hat made of bananas to the party.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were so wacko, they seemed to come from another planet.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wacko dancing in the rain stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To act in a crazy or irrational manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't wacko around with the scissors, you might get hurt.
meanings.sent2: She tends to wacko when she's stressed out.
meanings.sent3: He wackoed his way through the obstacle course, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The car wackoed down the road, swerving wildly.
meanings.sent5: The storm made the trees wacko in the wind, bending and twisting.
